headline: Cathie Wood Says Citrini Research's Take On AI 'Shocked' Financial Markets, Predicts Tech Will Cause 'Explosion' In Entrepreneurial Activity Instead
summary: Cathie Wood pushed back against Citrini Research's warning of an AI-driven economic downturn, arguing that artificial intelligence will instead fuel productivity, GDP growth and lower inflation, even as ARK Invest doubled down on DoorDash shares despite its recent earnings miss.

headline: The Stock That Didn’t Get Crushed by the AI Doomsday Essay
summary: Monday was a tough day for the stock market.  One factor hitting the stocks on Monday was an essay from Citrini Research, published on Sunday, that imagines a future in which AI devastates the economy.

raw.headline: The Stock That Didn’t Get Crushed by the AI Doomsday Essay

headline: Breaking Down the Doomsday AI Memo That Spooked Markets
summary: James van Geelen’s  Citrini Research has gained a cult following since it began publishing macro and thematic stock research in 2023, thanks in part to an early focus on artificial intelligence and weight-loss drugs.  Mass layoffs concentrated in traditionally high-paying fields begin to ripple through the economy.

headline: S&P 500 expected to start flat as new Trump tariffs begin

headline: DoorDash Blizzard Halt And Flavor Fest Raise Questions On Valuation
summary: DoorDash temporarily suspended operations in New York City as a blizzard and citywide travel ban disrupted normal activity. At the same time, the company rolled out its "Flavor Fest" campaign in the Washington, D.C. area, focused on promoting local restaurants. DoorDash, listed as NasdaqGS:DASH, is drawing attention for these two very different regional moves. The stock last closed at $164.66, with a 7 day return of 2.7%, a 30 day return showing a 20.5% decline, and a year to date return of...

headline: Race to the Bottom: Heard on the Street Monday Recap
summary: Stocks fell sharply, with a fresh round of trade and AI jitters. Over the weekend, President Trump said he would increase to 15% his new global tariff aimed at replacing many of the duties ruled illegal by the Supreme Court.

headline: Dow Jones Falls As Fictional AI White-Collar Wipeout Tale Strikes A Nerve
summary: American Express and other financial stocks dragged the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 lower on Monday as investors reacted to a bleak 2027 AI-driven recession scenario published by Citrini Research, a firm that offers thematic and global macro trading ideas.  The firm says it's bullish on AI's potential and wonders about the economic implications if the impact is so far-reaching that it turns out to be bearish.  American Express, Capital One Financial, Blackstone Financial and KKR were among companies in Citrini's fictional write-up that were among Monday's biggest S&P 500 laggards.

The firm says it's bullish on AI's potential and wonders about the economic implications if the impact is so far-reaching that it turns out to be bearish.  American Express, Capital One Financial, Blackstone Financial and KKR were among companies in Citrini's fictional write-up that were among Monday's biggest S&P 500 laggards.
